No Poverty.reason: The course focuses on Kyrgyz culture, society, and history, with no direct content on poverty alleviation.

Zero Hunger.reason: Food culture is mentioned (culinary traditions), but without addressing food security or hunger issues.

Good Health and Well-being.reason: Health and well-being are not core topics; minor relevance may come from discussions on traditional lifestyles.

Quality Education.reason: The course provides specialized knowledge of Kyrgyz society and culture, supporting higher education and learning outcomes.

Gender Equality.reason: No explicit coverage of gender equality; potential minor relevance through cultural discussions on social roles.

Clean Water and Sanitation.reason: No mention of water or sanitation issues in course content.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: Limited relevance; only indirect connections via understanding social structures and contemporary issues in Kyrgyz society.

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: Minimal relevance; course discusses cultural heritage and society, not industry or infrastructure.

Reduced Inequalities.reason: Understanding cultural and societal dynamics may indirectly inform awareness of social inequalities, minor relevance.

Sustainable Cities and Communities.reason: The course examines Kyrgyz society and cultural preservation, offering minor relevance to sustainable community concepts.

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: Some coverage of traditional practices may relate to responsible cultural practices, minor relevance.

Climate Action.reason: Environmental topics are not explicitly addressed in the syllabus.

Life Below Water.reason: No content related to aquatic ecosystems or biodiversity.

Life on Land.reason: Discussion of nomadic culture and land use provides minor relevance to terrestrial life awareness.

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: Course covers sociopolitical contexts and contemporary issues, providing moderate relevance to understanding institutions and governance.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: Minimal relevance; online seminars with Kyrgyz guest speakers provide limited exposure to international collaboration.
